resources.string: Prayagraj is a metropolitan city in the Indian state of Uttar Pradesh.It is well known for the Triveni Sangam, which is the meeting place of Ganges, the Yamuna and invisible Saraswati River, which according to Hindu legends, wells up from underground. A place of religious importance and the site for historic Prayagraj Maha Kumbh Mela held every 12 years, and Ardha Kumbh Mela every 6 years one of which is going to be held from January to March 2019.

Magh Mela is the most beloved religious and cultural fair of Hindus. According to the Hindu calendar, this fair is held in the month of Magha on the day of Makar Sankranti on 14 or 15 January. It is celebrated in all the major pilgrimage sites of India. Prayag having its major importance in Hindu mythology, according to Hindu religion, Lord Brahma, the creator of the universe, has been called it \'Tirtha Raj\' or King of Shrines.

Kumbh Mela, in Hinduism, is a religious pilgrimage that is celebrated four times over a course of 12 years. The geographical location of Kumbh Mela spans over four locations in India and the Mela site keeps rotating between one of the four pilgrimage places on four sacred rivers, most well known being Triveni Sangam of Prayagraj.

Prayagraj Fort is a fort built by the Mughal emperor Akbar at Prayagraj, Uttar Pradesh, India in 1583. The fort stands on the banks of the Yamuna near its confluence with the river Ganges. It is recognised by the Archaeological Survey of India as a monument of national importance.

Khusrau Bagh is a large walled garden and burial complex located in muhalla Khuldabad close to the Prayagraj Junction Station, in Prayagraj, India. It is roughly two miles from the Akbar built Prayagraj Fort.

All Saints\' Cathedral, also known as Patthar Girja is an Anglican cathedral located in Prayagraj, India. Modeled after 13th-century Gothic style churches, it is among the Gothic Revival buildings built by the British during their rule in India.
